_header: Whatso thou art goest here by me
_description: Death’s warning — one monorhyming quatrain translating ‘Si quis eris qui transieris sta respice plora’ which precedes it in John Grimestone’s sermon notebook

NLS18721.Transcription:
Watso þu art gost her be meWith stand & bee hold & wel
                    be þenk þeÞat suich as þu art was i wone to
                    be& suich as i am nou saltu sone be
NLS18721.Editions:
Owst,  Gerald Robert. 
             Preaching in Medieval England.
         Cambridge: UP, 1926; rev. ed. New York, 1961: 344.
